language.description: The language of the code file.

compilationFiles.description:
Extra files that should be placed alongside the code file during its compilation,
such as testlib.h, jngen.h, etc.

The paths should be given relative to the package directory, but will be included
relative to the `path` directory.

Testlib and jngen are already included by default.
compilationFiles.title: Compilationfiles

fallback_to.description: Checker to fall back to if the mainly specified checker does not exist.

mode.description: In which compatibility mode the checker should be run.
mode.title: Mode

glob.description: A glob pattern for the files to be used as unit test input for the checker.
glob.title: Glob

testplan.description: A testplan to be used as unit test input for the checker.
testplan.title: Testplan

outcome.description: The expected outcome of the checker.

such as testlib.h, jngen.h, etc.

outcome.description: The expected outcome of this solution.

tags.description: Tags to be associated with this solution.
tags.title: Tags

score.description:
The score of this solution in the final score.
Should either be an integer, which means the solution should have this exact score,
or a tuple of two integers, which means the solution should have a score between the two integers (inclusive).

If one of the integers is set to be null, it means that the solution should have a score between the other integer and negative/positive infinity.
score.title: Score

inheritFromContest.description: Whether the configuration for this statement should be inherited from the contest. When this field is set to true, the statement for this problem can only be built if it's within a contest and there is a contest statement matching it.
inheritFromContest.title: Inheritfromcontest

extends.description: Name of the statement that this statement extends.
extends.title: Extends

title.description: Title of the problem, as it appears in the statement. Can be left unset if the problem has no title or if title comes from the `titles` field of the package.
title.title: Title

path.description: Path to the input statement file.
path.title: Path

type.description: Type of the input statement file.

steps.description:
Describes a sequence of conversion steps that should be applied to the statement file.

Usually, it is not necessary to specify these, as they can be inferred from the
input statement type and the output statement type, but you can use this to force
certain conversion steps to happen.
steps.title: Steps

configure.description:
Configure how certain conversion steps should happen when applied to the statement file.

Different from the `steps` field, this does not force the steps to happen, but rather only
configure them in case they are applied.
configure.title: Configure

assets.description:
Assets relative to the package directory that should be included while building
the statement. Files will be included in the same folder as the statement file, preserving
their relativeness. Can be glob pattern as well, such as `imgs/*.png`.
assets.title: Assets

vars.description: Variables to be used in the statement.

samples.description: Whether to build the statement with samples.
samples.title: Samples

name.description: The name of the stress test.
name.title: Name

generator.description: Generator pattern to call during stress-test.

finder.description: Finder expression to be used to match against generated tests.
finder.title: Finder

inputPath.description: The path of the input file.
inputPath.title: Inputpath

outputPath.description: The path of the output file.
outputPath.title: Outputpath

name.description: The name of the test group.
name.title: Name

testcases.description:
The path of testcases to add to this group,
in the order they're defined.
testcases.title: Testcases

testcaseGlob.description:
A Python glob that matches input file paths relative to the
package directory. The globbed files should end with the extension
".in", and their corresponding outputs, if defined, should have the same file name,
but ending with ".ans".
testcaseGlob.title: Testcaseglob

generators.description: A list of generators to call to generate testcases for this group.
generators.title: Generators

generatorScript.description: A generator script to call to generate testcases for this group.

extraValidators.description: A list of extra validators to use to validate the testcases of this subgroup.
extraValidators.title: Extravalidators

outputValidators.description: A list of output validators to use to validate the output of the testcases of this subgroup.
outputValidators.title: Outputvalidators

visualizer.description: The visualizer for this problem. Used to produced visualizations for the testcases. Has priority over the visualizer specified in the package.

solutionVisualizer.description: The solution visualizer for this problem. Used to produced visualizations for the outputs of the testcases. Has priority over the solution visualizer specified in the package.

subgroups.description: A list of test subgroups to define for this group.
subgroups.title: Subgroups

validator.description:
A validator to use to validate the testcases of this group.
If specified, will use this validator instead of the package-level validator.
Useful in cases where the constraints vary across test groups.

score.description:
The score of this group in the final score. Useful for
problems that have points.
score.title: Score

deps.description:
A list of other groups this group depends on to run and be considered accepted.

The `samples` group is implicitly a dependency of every other group.
deps.title: Deps

model_solution.description:
The solution to be used to generate outputs for this testgroup.

Can only be set for the "samples" testgroup.

name.description: The name of the test group.
name.title: Name

testcases.description:
The path of testcases to add to this group,
in the order they're defined.
testcases.title: Testcases

testcaseGlob.description:
A Python glob that matches input file paths relative to the
package directory. The globbed files should end with the extension
".in", and their corresponding outputs, if defined, should have the same file name,
but ending with ".ans".
testcaseGlob.title: Testcaseglob

generators.description: A list of generators to call to generate testcases for this group.
generators.title: Generators

generatorScript.description: A generator script to call to generate testcases for this group.

extraValidators.description: A list of extra validators to use to validate the testcases of this subgroup.
extraValidators.title: Extravalidators

outputValidators.description: A list of output validators to use to validate the output of the testcases of this subgroup.
outputValidators.title: Outputvalidators

visualizer.description: The visualizer for this problem. Used to produced visualizations for the testcases. Has priority over the visualizer specified in the package.

solutionVisualizer.description: The solution visualizer for this problem. Used to produced visualizations for the outputs of the testcases. Has priority over the solution visualizer specified in the package.

TexToPDF.description: Configures the conversion between LaTeX and PDF using pdfLaTeX.

demacro.description: Whether to save macro definitions to a JSON file.
demacro.title: Demacro

TexToPDF.title: TexToPDF

glob.description: A glob pattern for the input files to be used as unit test input for the validator.
glob.title: Glob

testplan.description: A testplan to be used as unit test input for the validator.
testplan.title: Testplan

outcome.description: The expected outcome of the validator.

validator.description: The validator to use for this test. If not specified, will use the package-level validator.

path.description: The path to the code file, relative to the package directory.
path.title: Path

language.description: The language of the code file.
language.title: Language

compilationFiles.description:
Extra files that should be placed alongside the code file during its compilation,
such as testlib.h, jngen.h, etc.

The paths should be given relative to the package directory, but will be included
relative to the `path` directory.

Testlib and jngen are already included by default.
compilationFiles.title: Compilationfiles

extension.description: The extension of the visualization file generated by the visualizer.
extension.title: Extension

answer_from.description:
Program to generate additional answer file to pass to the visualizer.
        If not specified, the reference answer file will be used.
answer_from.title: Answer From

rbxMarkdownToTeX.description: Configures the conversion between rbxMarkdown and LaTeX.
rbxMarkdownToTeX.title: rbxMarkdownToTeX

rbxToTeX.description: Configures the conversion between rbxTeX and LaTeX.

template.description: Path to the template that should be used to render the rbx-tex blocks.
template.title: Template

rbxToTeX.title: rbxToTeX

titles.description: Titles for the problem in each language. Languages should be specified as lowercase ISO 639-1 codes.
titles.title: Titles

scoring.description: The scoring type of the problem.

timeLimit.description: Time limit of the problem, in milliseconds.
timeLimit.title: Timelimit

memoryLimit.description: Memory limit of the problem, in MB.
memoryLimit.title: Memorylimit

outputLimit.description: Output limit of the problem, in KB.
outputLimit.title: Outputlimit

modifiers.description: Limit modifiers that can be specified per language.
modifiers.title: Modifiers

outputValidators.description: A list of output validators to use to validate the output of the testcases of this problem.
outputValidators.title: Outputvalidators

visualizer.description: The visualizer for this problem. Used to produced visualizations for the testcases.

solutionVisualizer.description: The solution visualizer for this problem. Used to produced visualizations for the outputs of the testcases.

solutions.description:
All tested solutions for this problem.

The first solution in this list should be the main solution -- the one
that is correct and used as reference -- and should have the `accepted` outcome.
solutions.title: Solutions

vars.description: Variables to be re-used across the package.

unitTests.description: Unit tests for components of this problem.
